They have the same value for all variable inputs
They have the same coefficients

The variable itself
A value that makes the equation true
A number you plug into any equation
The slope of a line

The y-intercept
The rate of change of y with respect to x
The horizontal intercept
The average of x and y

The slope
The y-intercept
The x-intercept
The rate of change

They are equal
They are opposites
Their product is 1
They intersect at one point

A symbol that represents an unknown or changeable value
A fixed numerical value
A mathematical constant
An operation sign

It contains x raised to the power of 2

Simplifies it by combining like terms
Rewrites it as a product of simpler expressions

Changes the coefficients

It falls from left to right
It is horizontal

To divide one expression by another
To multiply a term across terms inside parentheses

To simplify fractions
